quotes.quote: Acting is the least mysterious of all crafts. Whenever we want something from somebody or when we want to hide something or pretend, we're acting. Most people do it all day long.
Acting is a marvelous profession ... If you can spend enough time playing other people, you don't have to think too much about your own character and motivations.

Acting is a sport. On stage you must be ready to move like a tennis player on his toes. Your concentration must be keen, your reflexes sharp; your body and mind are in top gear, the chase is on. Acting is energy. In the theatre people pay to see energy.
Acting deals with very delicate emotions. It is not putting up a mask. Each time an actor acts he does not hide; he exposes himself.
Acting is magical. Change your look and your attitude, and you can be anyone.
Acting is all about honesty. If you can fake that, you've got it made.
Acting is the expression of a neurotic impulse. It's a bum's life. Quitting acting, that's the sign of maturity.
Acting is a nice childish profession - pretending you're someone else and, at the same time, selling yourself.
Acting is not about being famous, it's about exploring the human soul.
Film acting is one of the only industries where you're criticized for working hard. In any other industry, it's considered a quality and something to behold.
Acting is a question of absorbing other people's personalities and adding some of your own experience.
Great acting is not easy; anyone who says it is is either shallow or a charlatan. And one of the hardest things about acting is admitting that it is hard
Acting is half shame, half glory. Shame at exhibiting yourself, glory when you can forget yourself.
Acting is not being emotional, but being able to fully express emotion.
Acting is a spiritual quest to touch human beings.
Acting provides the fulfillment of never being fulfilled. You're never as good as you'd like to be. So there's always something to hope for.
Acting is nothing more or less than playing. The idea is to humanize life.
Acting doesn't bring anything to a text. On the contrary, it detracts from it.
Acting is not about dressing up. Acting is about stripping bare. The whole essence of learning lines is to forget them so you can make them sound like you thought of them that instant.
I must say that acting was good training for the political life that lay ahead of us.
Acting is not about being someone different. It's finding the similarity in what is apparently different, then finding myself in there.

As always, with acting, you can't be too self-conscious. You shouldn't care about what people are thinking about you at the time because they're not caring about you, they're caring about the character.
The art of acting consists in keeping people from coughing.
People acting in their own self-interest is the fuel for all the discovery, innovation, and prosperity that powers the world.
Acting is like a Halloween mask that you put on.
Acting is happy agony.
Acting is a matter of giving away secrets.
I really think that effective acting has to do literally with the movement of molecules.
Acting is standing up naked and turning around very slowly.
Conflict is what creates drama. The more conflict actors find, the more interesting the performance.
Acting is behaving truthfully under imaginary circumstances.
The actor has to develop his body. The actor has to work on his voice. But the most important thing the actor has to work on is his mind.
Acting requires faith. You just have to believe that you are the person you’re playing and that what is happening is happening to you.
The thing I like about acting is being able to lose yourself completely in someone else. I’m not that comfortable when I get recognised.

The difference between acting and reacting is that in a bad picture, you see them acting all over the place. In a good picture, they react in a logical way to a situation they're in, so the audience can identify with the actors.
I merely try to act naturally. If I start acting phony on the screen, you start looking at me instead of feeling with me.

Acting... is the ability to react to imaginary stimuli; and its essential elements remain the twin requisites... 'unusual sensitivity and extraordinary intelligence,' this latter not in the form of book learning but in the ability to comprehend the workings of the human soul. The essential problems in acting—does the actor 'feel' or does he merely imitate? Should he speak naturally or rhetorically? What is natural? etc.—are as old as acting itself. They derive not from the realistic movement but from the nature of the acting process.

Of all the arts, I think acting must be the least concrete, the most solitary. One gains experience continually, both at rehearsals and in performance, from the presence of a large assembly of people. These people are essential to the development of one's performance—they are the living canvas upon which one hopes to paint the finished portrait which one has envisaged.
Acting is horrible, painful, and yet also intoxicating and emotionally liberating.
Acting is an intimate thing. You entrust your partner with something very private, a tremendous bond develops and that intimacy is like love.
Acting provides the fulfillment of never being fulfilled. You're never as good as you'd like to be. So there's always something to hope for.
Acting is simply my way of investigating human nature and having fun at the same time.
Acting is the ability to dream on cue.
Acting is a sad business where you crawl from hope to hope.
Acting is a leap of faith. There has to be that moment where you go, I give myself to ... the spirit.

Thrust into my profession without any training whatsoever, I had to just flounder and just find my way. It was an agonizing experience. It's like jumping off a diving board in the Olympic contest without knowing how to swim or dive, and I just had to find my way. So one day, I said to Jimmy Cagney, 'Jimmy, what is acting?' and he said, 'I don't know.' He said, 'All I can tell you is whatever you say, mean it,' and I thought that marvelous counsel. It is key. Wonderful.
Acting is a great panacea. I can turn the world to right, all the sad and distressing things that happen in real life can be transformed into something soothing and great.
Like all actors, I really just reveal my shadow every time I work. And the shadow is all the pain, shame, anger and rage, the creativity and sexuality.
Acting is so pure. It's not necessarily all the mundane moments that we have in real life. It's like condensed drama. It's all the exciting moments in two hours. Your senses have to be heightened.
Actors are people who were good at playing 'Let's Pretend' as kids and now we're getting money to play house.

They say that all great actors are crazy. Life has driven them mad, but that madness gives them a well of opportunity to draw experiences from 'til they can relate to what seems obscure and far away and out of reach.
Acting is only the second oldest profession, but society has always looked on both trades with equal suspicion.
An actor is akin to the magician—an illusionist in the profession of making things look real.
Being the wood that the nail banged into doesn't feel good—that's what acting is.
Sometimes you want to tell the audience, "If you only knew what we've been going through!"
Acting is the most minor of gifts and not a very high-class way to earn a living. Shirley Temple could do it at the age of four.
The mere mechanical technique of acting can be taught, but the spirit that is to give life to lifeless forms must be born in a man. No dramatic college can teach its pupils to think or to feel.
Without wonder and insight, acting is just a trade. With it, it becomes  creation.
Acting deals with very delicate emotions. It is not putting up a mask. Each time an actor acts he does not hide; he exposes himself.
Acting is like prize fighting. The downtown gyms are smelly, but that's where the champions are.
The basic essential of a great actor is that he loves himself in acting.
You spend all your life trying to do something they put people in asylums for.
Acting is a masochistic form of exhibitionism. It is not quite the occupation of an adult.
A painter paints, a musician plays, a writer writes - but a movie actor waits.
To grasp the full significance of life is the actor's duty, to interpret it is his problem, and to express it his dedication.
Acting is just making stuff up. But, that's okay. Life is a rehearsal. Life is an improvisation.
We could change the whole story of love / Same old play I'm getting tired / No more acting these predictable roles / Just us living / Unconditional love.
